      • tilesToTileViews

        public static java.util.List<TileView> tilesToTileViews(java.util.List<Tile> targettableTiles)
        Create a list of tile views to send to the client, limiting the possible data visible from the client. It use the static funcion createTileView
        Parameters:
        targettableTiles - the tiles from which create the list of tile views
        Returns:
        the new list of the views

      • getTileFromMap

        public static Tile getTileFromMap(java.util.List<java.util.List<Tile>> tilesToCheck,
                                  TileView tView)
        Given a map composed of tile it checks if a tile view is in that list simply by checking his coordinates
        Parameters:
        tilesToCheck - the map from which to check if a tile exist
        tView - the tile that is asked if exist
        Returns:
        the tile or null

      • getNotifyObservers

        public java.util.List<ViewProxy> getNotifyObservers()

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Set up the board by filling every spawn point with weapons and every other tile with ammo tiles. Shuffle the players to give them a random order, set up clients' board and start the game

      • changeTurn

        public void changeTurn()
        this method changes the turn of the game, passing to the next gamemode or ending the game if necessary

      • onEffectiveChangeTurn

        private void onEffectiveChangeTurn(Player oldPlayer)
        this method is called when all the player that needed to respawn effectively respawned. The turn can finally change and players can be notified.
        Parameters:
        oldPlayer - the old current player that has to be replaced

      • restartPlayerTimer

        private void restartPlayerTimer()
        This method uses the NetworkManager observer to notify the network manager to restart the timer of the turn

      • setNewCurrentPlayer

        private void setNewCurrentPlayer()
        this method sets the new current player if no one has to respawn. If someone has to respawn then the setting of the new current player is delayed after the respawn.

      • spawnDisconnectedPlayer

        private void spawnDisconnectedPlayer(Player player)
        This method is used in the situation in which a disconnected player has to spawn after his death. It gives him a random powerup and immediately discard it makin him spawn.
        Parameters:
        player - the disconnected player to spawn

        public void nextPlayer()
        sets the new current Player that has to play the turn

        public void manageEndOfFrenzy()

      • manageEndOfNormal

        public void manageEndOfNormal()
        this methods manages the end of sudden death mode. It will end the game if the selected mode is sudden death. If not he will start the final frenzy mode.

        public void spawnDrawPhase(Player player,
                           int numberOfCards)
        Makes the player that has to spawn draw the powerups he needs
        Parameters:
        player - the player that has to spawn
        numberOfCards - the powerUps the player has to draw: 1 to respawn, 2 to spawn

                             PowerUp powerUp)
        Method to make a player spawn after the user select a powerup
        Parameters:
        player - the player that has spawned/respawn
        powerUp - the discarded powerUp to spawn

      • endOfGame

        public void endOfGame()
        Method to manage the end of the game. It calculates the points to assign to each player by sorting them, notifing every one both of clients' points and of the end of the game

      • createFinalRank

        Returns:
        the list of players of the game sorted by the highest points

      • getVisibleTiles

        private java.util.List<Tile> getVisibleTiles(Player player)
        Method to know which tiles a player can see. It cannot see through the walls but only in his room and adjacent ones throuh doors
        Parameters:
        player - the player for which we need to know the tiles he can see
        Returns:
        the list of the tile the player can see

      • getPossibleTiles

                                             int maxDist,
                                             Tile t1)
        Parameters:
        minDist - the in distance of the range
        maxDist - the max distance of the range
        t1 - the starting point tile
        Returns:
        the list of tiles in the selected range having the starting point in the specified tile

      • getDistanceBetweenTiles

        public int getDistanceBetweenTiles(Tile t1,
                                   Tile t2)
        Method to calculate the distance between two tiles not considering walls or holes. It's the distance that a player can freely walk
        Parameters:
        t1 - the starting point
        t2 - the end point
        Returns:
        the distance as an integer between two tiles

                         Player marker,
                         int marks,
                         int oldMarks)

        Parameters:

        marker - the player who give the marks

        oldMarks - the amount of marks he holds before this

                           int marksDown)

        Parameters:

        target - the player who received the damage
        damage - the amount of damage
        marksDown - the amount of marks that have to became damage

                                Player newPlayer,
                                java.util.List<Tile> tiles)
        Send notify of changing turn to update clients' local context
        Parameters:
        endPlayer - the player who ends his turn
        newPlayer - the player who begins his turn

      • notifyOnKillUpdate

        public void notifyOnKillUpdate(Player killer,
                               boolean overKill,
                               Player killed)
        Send notify of someone killing another player to update clients' local context
        Parameters:
        killer - the player who made the kill
        overKill - the boolean indicating if there's a overkill
        killed - the player that has been killed

      • notifyOnPoints

        public void notifyOnPoints(java.util.Map<PlayerView,java.lang.Integer> points,
                           boolean doubleKill,
                           Player scoredOn)
        Send notify of someone scoring points to update clients' local context
        Parameters:
        points - the point made
        doubleKill - the boolean indicating if there was overkill
        scoredOn - the player killed

      • notifyOnEndGame

        private void notifyOnEndGame(java.util.List<Player> rank)
        Send notify of ending game to update clients' local context. It also end every timer and call the end game method from network manager
        Parameters:
        rank - the final leaderboard in which player are sorted by their points
